The NVelocity.Init(ExtendedProperties) method has a very strange bug: it converts every configuration value into a string.
You can track this execution following this path:
NVelocity.App.Velocity.Init(ExtendedProperties): line 68 NVelocity.Runtime.RuntimeSingleton.init(ExtendedProperties): line 204 NVelocity.Runtime.RuntimeInstance.init(ExtendedProperties): line 381 Commons.ExtendedProperties.ConvertProperties(ExtendedProperties): line 1452 (the bug is caused here)
It's usually not an Issue, but I need to add an ArrayList to the extended properties, and it's holding me back.
The proper way to use the ExtendedProperties is to call the parameterless Velocity.Init() method, this way:
Velocity.ExtendedProperties = props; Velocity.Init();
This way, ExtendedProperties.ConvertProperties() is not called.
I'm sending a patch with this one and several other NVelocityVE improvements.
